clips.title: N.Y. launches HIV self-test giveaway campaign to address disparities, DOH says
clips.preview: Thursday, Jun. 27 is recognized as National HIV Testing Day. A digital HIV awareness campaign has been launched by the New York State Department of Health (DOH) to coincide with the occasion.
clips.creditText: With 'Level up your self-love: check your status' marking the theme of this year's National HIV Testing Day, the DOH wrote in their Jun. 27 press release that a digital HIV awareness campaign has been launched to coincide with the occasion.(WRGB)

clips.title: Brother mourns Canadian pilot: 'Where does one begin to describe Natalie Gillis?'
clips.preview: 'Natalie was an amazing person. I'm sure if there was any way she could, she would have tried to avoid the houses,' said Mattew Yap, who traveled to Albany from Toronto to pick up the remains of Natalie Gillis, the Canadian pilot killed in the crash of Aircraft C-GKSI.

clips.title: Man indicted for assaulting child to retaliate against federal trial witness
clips.preview: An 18-year-old Schenectady man was put behind bars for allegedly assaulting a child of a witness who testified in a federal criminal trial, according to the Northern District of New York United States Department of Justice.
clips.creditText: Man indicted for assaulting child to retaliate against federal trial witness.(WRGB)

clips.title: Saratoga Springs violated BLM protesters First Amendment rights, Attorney General says
clips.preview: The Office of New York Attorney General (OAG) found the City of Saratoga Springs violated 2020-21 Black Lives Matter protesters' First Amendment rights.
clips.creditText: Saratoga Springs Police, including two mounted units, attempt to separate demonstrators from a pro-police 'Black the Blue' rally and BLM and All of Us counter protesters on July 30th, 2020 (WRGB)

clips.title: Making Gender X marker available to New Yorkers is a 'cherished moment,' DMV says
clips.preview: While New Yorkers encounter both celebration and scrutiny for the 2024 Pride Month, the New York State Department of Motor Vehicles (DMV) made a statement on Friday, Jun. 14, standing their ground as an LGBTQA+ ally.
clips.creditText: Making Gender X marker available to New Yorkers is a 'cherished moment,' DMV says (Courtesy: NYS DMV)

clips.title: Lake George advocacy group protests State's use of controversial herbicide
clips.preview: Lake George Association made a statement on Tuesday, May 28, pushing back against New York Stateâ€™s application of an aquatic herbicide to Lake George.
